intro: Sphaeralcea subhastata subsp. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in dry, rocky habitats. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
